greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The largest prime whose square divides n, 1 if n is squarefree.
comment: A249739 gives the corresponding smallest prime.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(1) = 1, and for n > 1, if A241917(n) = 0 [i.e., n is a term of A070003], a(n) = A006530(n), otherwise a(n) = a(A052126(n)).
mathematica: a[n_] := If[(f = Select[FactorInteger[n], Last[#] > 1 &]) == {}, 1, f[[-1, 1]]]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 11 2021 *)
program: (define (A249740 n) (let loop ((n n) (p (A006530 n))) (cond ((= 1 n) n) ((zero? (modulo n (* p p))) p) (else (loop (/ n p) (A006530 (/ n p)))))))
;; Alternative version which is based on the given recurrence, and utilizes the memoizing definec-macro from _Antti Karttunen_'s IntSeq-library:
xref: Differs from A071773 and A249739 for the first time at n=36, where a(36) = 3, while A249739(36) = 2 and A071773(36) = 6.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 04 2014
